DOC.brief_summary: The objective this trial is to compare immediate and 12 hours postoperative removal of urinary catheter after elective cesarean section; and whether early removal is associated with lower risk of urinary infection compared with delayed catheter removal.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Immediate Versus Delayed Removal of Urinary Catheter Following Elective Cesarean Section
DOC.criteria: Women admitted to the prenatal wards for primary or repeat elective cesarean section urinary infection (assessed clinically and by midstream urinalysis), significant vaginal bleeding, severe preeclampsia or eclampsia and/or any other conditions requiring postoperative monitoring of urinary output, and contraindications for general anesthesia.
